data spaces were defined multiple times
and there were multiple phrasings around
that um but the most the best definition
currently available is the open Dei
definition which states that a data
space is defined as a decentralized
infrastructure for trustworthy data
sharing and exchange in ecosystem based
on commonly agreed principles and there
are three important points here to take
so the first one is
decentralization so we don't want to
have one big pool where we throw every
all data from from everyone in and then
analyze them so we want to have the data
separated to where where it it's
generated this has benefits but also
drawbacks when when you store the data
closely to where it is generated the
data prod producers have full control
over access and can um can decide where
where and who and what gets access to
their data and under which conditions
this access granted this also enables a

have different file formats different
storage formats different storage
methods um one person uses s S3 the
other person uses a standard file system
um and you can integrate existing
infrastructures which is quite hard when
you have a very diverse infrastructure
available and this also enables
multivendor operations so you can have
one one participant from Google cloud
and the other one from from AWS and
integrate both of them the main drawback
here is it's it's a lot of overhead to
synchronize all these data sources
across different platforms and it's also
a lot of overhead regarding traffic so
Ingress and egress is always a problem
regarding this because you need to ship
around more of the data between the
different locations to make common
analysis
possible the the second thing I talked

principles
um there was a very famous paper around
6 eight years ago um where Mark Wilson
announced the fair principles of data
sharing and fair stands for findable
accessible interoperable and reusable
findable means you need to know where
the data is at least you need to know

accessible means there must be a way in
in certain standards where everyone
agrees with to to access the data it
